page.title: 01A SUMMARY_NORTHLEACH AREA
page.content: Northleach is a small, historic town, situated to the east of the crossroads of the A429 Fosseway and the former A40 road. It lies within the Cotswold Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The community is an active one with a parish church, a grammar and a primary school, a county museum, fire and police stations, a selection of shops and many activities It is, however, a town in a crisis because of the decline in population by 7%, 1971_81 and the decline in the proportion of young people. In 1985 Draft Proposals for the area were produced_notably to allow limited 'family housing' development and to create employment through expansion of tourism and small_scale industrial ventures. Since the opening of the bypass in 1984 such development is feasible _some would say essential.
